channel.title: Comments on: Haggadah roundup 2011
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Yossi
item.dc:creator: Yossi
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/05/06/haggadah-roundup-2011/#comment-3038">Larry Yudelson</a>.
It's totally different. It's not so much a commentary as a collection of Chidushei Torah on different sugyas in Pesachim. It is not the type of Hagaddah you would use at the seder for saying Divrei Torah.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Larry Yudelson.

It’s totally different. It’s not so much a commentary as a collection of Chidushei Torah on different sugyas in Pesachim. It is not the type of Hagaddah you would use at the seder for saying Divrei Torah.

item.title: By: Mordechai Y. Scher
item.dc:creator: Mordechai Y. Scher
item.description: One of the most interesting haggadot to come out of your neck of the woods is the haggadah from Hoboken; Rav Hirschensohn's. I think it was part of his luach.
item.content:encoded: One of the most interesting haggadot to come out of your neck of the woods is the haggadah from Hoboken; Rav Hirschensohn’s. I think it was part of his luach.

item.title: By: chakira
item.dc:creator: chakira
item.description: I like this Haggadah roundup format. I used machon schechter and as always, biala rebbe. Re: RY Eyebeschutz, I just saw this morning in the compilation Yaari im Divashi that he says the majority of people in his community drink yayin nesach since they assume that they will not end up having forbidden relations from it. But it is guaranteed that they will! Besides which even Jewish wine is not necessarily Kosher because so many people are in the category of muumar. Additionally, Pawel Maciejko has a nice long section on Rabbeinu Wolf Eyebeschutz which compares him to Casanova and Jacob Frank.
item.content:encoded:
I like this Haggadah roundup format. I used machon schechter and as always, biala rebbe.
Re: RY Eyebeschutz, I just saw this morning in the compilation Yaari im Divashi that he says the majority of people in his community drink yayin nesach since they assume that they will not end up having forbidden relations from it. But it is guaranteed that they will! Besides which even Jewish wine is not necessarily Kosher because so many people are in the category of muumar.
Additionally, Pawel Maciejko has a nice long section on Rabbeinu Wolf Eyebeschutz which compares him to Casanova and Jacob Frank.

item.title: By: Mordy
item.dc:creator: Mordy
item.description: What is the Riskin baby carriage story? I'm not familiar...
item.content:encoded: What is the Riskin baby carriage story? I’m not familiar…

item.title: By: Lawrence Kaplan
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Kaplan
item.description: There are two Rav Haggadot in English: one edited by Rabbi Yosef Adler, the other by Rabbi Menahem Genack. I assume Dr. Brill is referring to the former. I do not understand why he is being coy here.
item.content:encoded: There are two Rav Haggadot in English: one edited by Rabbi Yosef Adler, the other by Rabbi Menahem Genack. I assume Dr. Brill is referring to the former. I do not understand why he is being coy here.

item.title: By: Larry Yudelson
item.dc:creator: Larry Yudelson
item.description: Yossi, how is Siach HaGrid? How does it compare to the Teaneck Rav Haggadah?
item.content:encoded: Yossi, how is Siach HaGrid? How does it compare to the Teaneck Rav Haggadah?

item.title: By: Yossi
item.dc:creator: Yossi
item.description: Rav Yitzchok Lichtenstein re-issued his hagaddah, "Siach HaGrid" this year.
item.content:encoded: Rav Yitzchok Lichtenstein re-issued his hagaddah, “Siach HaGrid” this year.
